remarks: For any two elements of a directed set, there exists a third element greater than or equal to both.  (Note that this does not say that the two elements have a _least_ upper bound.)  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 25-Nov-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Nov-2013.)
statement:
dirge.1 $e |- X = dom R $.
dirge $p |- ( ( R e. DirRel /\ A e. X /\ B e. X ) -> E. x e. X ( A R x /\ B R x ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d R x $.
$d X x $.
